explanation and examples.material: the stoichiometric formula, following the IUCr definition of a chemical formula.
explanation and examples.name: mineral, common, or IUPAC name of the compound
explanation and examples.location: where the measurable sample can be found at BMM
explanation and examples.incollection: true/false, does BMM have a sample on hand
explanation and examples.refwheel: true/false, is it normally on the reference wheel
explanation and examples.missing: true/false, if present and true for a sample that should be in the collection, but isn't
explanation and examples.fluorescence: true/false, if present and true, mark this sample as having been measured in fluorescence
explanation and examples.datafile: if not false, the name of the K or L3 data file
explanation and examples.datafile2: if present and not false, the name of the L1 data file
